__data__.text:
"Plant Ma nager   @ Cinci nnati , OH" 
 
Client Industry: Print Label  Manufacturing . 
Client Name and Website:  OMNI Systems |  www. omnisystem .com/  
 
 Job Description  
The Plant Manager has broad overall responsibility for the business. The Plant Manager will oversee all 
daily operations of the plant from production and manufacturing to ensuring policies and procedures are 
followed. They develop processes that will maximize stewardship, safety, quality, and productivity.  
The Plant Manager is responsible for strategy, structure, budgets, people, financial outcomes, and 
scorecard metrics. Plant Managers need to be familiar with all areas of the business and can coordinate 
processes and operations across the organization. A Plant manager usually must speak the languages of 
finance and accounting, operations, sales, marketing, human resources, research and development, and 
engineering.  
Plant Manager Duties & Responsibilities  
The Plant Manager's duties and responsibilities are:  
• Plan, organize, direct, and run optimum day -to-day operations to exceed our customers’ 
expectations.  
• Increase production, assets capacity and flexibility while minimizing unnecessary costs and 
maintaining current quality standards.  
• Implement strategies in alignment with strategic initiatives and provide a clear sense of direction 
and focus  
• Share a trusting relationship with the workgroup and recruit, manage and develop plant staff  
• Develop systems and processes that track and optimize productivity and standards, metrics, and 
performance targets to ensure effective return on assets  
• Engage with corporate officers in broader organizational strategic planning.  
• Stay up to date with the latest production management best practices and concepts  
Plant Manager Skills & Competencies  
• Strategic planning skills :The Plant Manager must ensure the development and implementation 
of a clear strategic plan for an organization or business unit.  
• Financial planning skills : Plant Managers are responsible for looking at the future of the 
business and making key investments and investment recommendations.  
• Interpersonal skills :Plant Managers must be able to support the development of a healthy 
internal culture that retains key employees and encourages their professional development.  
• Leadership skills :Plant Managers are responsible for leading entire business units or divisions 
of an organization.  
Job Requirements  
• The minimum education required for this position is a Bachelor’s Degree in Business, 
Engineering, or Production Management. Seven to ten years of experience or an equivalent

combination of education, training, and experience in Flexographic Printing or other types of print 
manufacturing.  
• Strong verbal and written communications skills, supervisory experience, PC, and analytical skills 
are a must; knowledge of the pressure -sensitive label converting industry as well as pricing and 
marketing skills are required.  
• The minimum related language skills required for this position is the ability to read, analyze, and 
interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, governmental 
regulations, and numerical data. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure 
manuals. Must be able to effectively present information and respond to questions from 
management, customers, sales representatives, and employees.  
• This position requires an ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and 
statistical inference. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and 
proportions to practical situations to printing jobs.  
Physical Requirements & Environmental Conditions  
• This position requires the incumbent to use color vision, hearing, sitting for prolonged periods, 
speaking and articulating, and lifting less than 25 pounds on a constant basis, stand, walk, use 
hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear.  
• This position requires the incumbent to carry, hear, stand, walk, grasp, reach, and at times travel.  
• Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, and 
the ability to adjust focus.  
• While performing the duties of this job, the employee could be exposed to humid conditions, 
fumes, toxic chemicals, and heat. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to 
loud.
